intro: Pelargonium × glabrum, commonly known as the common geranium, is a popular ornamental plant characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy flowers. It is a hybrid species within the Geraniaceae family, originating from crosses between various pelargonium species. The plant typically produces clusters of five-petaled flowers in shades of red, pink, and white, which bloom throughout the growing season. Its leaves are usually glossy and may have a slightly hairy texture, depending on the cultivar. Pelargonium × glabrum is often cultivated in gardens and as a potted plant due to its adaptability and aesthetic appeal.
